intro: Macrocarpaea gracilis, commonly known as the slender macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. The plant has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
